function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Occupant behavior impacting indoor environment and disease transmission routes in buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of occupant behaviors and their impact on disease transmission routes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological factors influencing occupant behaviors related to disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Few risk calculators account for all three routes of transmission: fomite, airborne, and droplets, potentially underestimating the virus exposure dose for occupants","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited understanding of the integrated effects of solutions, such as whether different interventions are additive, multiplicative, or contradictory in their outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient investigation of the cost-effectiveness of various interventions and combinations, including ongoing maintenance costs, energy consumption, and impacts on the fm budget","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Respiratory virus transmission dynamics influenced by multiple architectural and environmental factors","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cost-effectiveness and outcome studies in space management for infection control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complexity of evaluating the risk of sars-cov-2 infection in indoor environments","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Routine disinfection timeframes not being followed for contacted surfaces and items","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Higher occupant density leading to increased physical contact and exposure to shared air","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of touchless operation technology for common office items and facilities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of respiratory virus transmission via interior surfaces due to occupant hand-surface contact","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne virus leakage from the drain due to poorly designed or maintained trap seal retention system","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of systematic guidance for drainage system operation and maintenance for infection control","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transmission of respiratory viruses via contaminated indoor surfaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission risk due to traditional HVAC systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral aerosols transmitted via building drainage system","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of upper-room UVGI system due to location and operation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decline in upper-room UVGI systems efficiency with rising humidity levels","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of virus transmission through building heating systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate disinfection of indoor surfaces in vast open spaces and shadowed areas such as bedrails and telephones in a ward","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Concerns regarding occupants’ exposure to UV in upper-room UVGI systems","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence of upper-room UVGI system effectiveness on building parameters and system design","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential inefficacy of UVGI technology in disinfecting indoor air and surfaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited effectiveness of in-duct UVGI systems due to ventilation system efficiency and fan capacity","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Diminished ability of UVGI to disinfect indoor surfaces in the presence of dirt and debris","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Accumulation of pathogenic particles on ioniser and surrounding surfaces due to negative air ionisation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of assessment and comparison of infection risk associated with lighting factors that reflect sunlight exposure","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient assessment of the effectiveness of UVGI systems in mitigating the spread of contagious diseases in healthcare settings","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Air pressure controls affected by air leaks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Hazardous waste from filter disposal","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction of airflow rate caused by filters","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Elevated indoor noise levels from PAC operation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective placement of PACs leading to uneven air purification and particle removal in the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective operation and maintenance of HEPA filtration systems leading to reduced efficiency in particle removal and air purification","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Experimental studies with simulated aerosol particles in various indoor environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mixed effects of combining ventilation and PACs in buildings with central ventilation systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Diminished efficiency of PACs as mechanical ventilation in rooms increases","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate air mixing in rooms with a mixing ventilation system may result in atypical distribution of micro-organisms, increasing infection risk","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited investigation of the effects of HEPA filters on ventilation grills and in real-world settings may lead to incomplete understanding of their efficacy in reducing viral transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of virus transmission patterns in various indoor spaces, including restaurants, houses, classrooms, and gyms, may lead to ineffective infection control measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Natural ventilation may be compromised in cold weather, leading to reduced outdoor airflow","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mechanically ventilated rooms may have significantly varying ventilation rates depending on their location and layout","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Displacement ventilation promotes vertical stratification and higher ventilation effectiveness but may have mixed cost-effectiveness","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"CO2 concentration as a sole indicator for airborne infection risk","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of air flushing in reducing particle concentrations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in controlling ventilation rate for natural ventilation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation rates in high-occupancy buildings leading to increased risk of airborne disease transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adverse outcomes of increasing ventilation rate, including indoor discomfort, higher energy consumption, and increased CO2 emissions","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
